body: There is no concurrency happens in the lock. Otherwise, JVM lock fails.
the key point is the second thread don't need to execute the line 159 code because the allJars is not null.

@wu-sheng, I'm having trouble figuring out which e2e tests are failing and how I can run these tests locally. I can see how to write e2e tests (https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/README.md#writing-e2e-cases), but not how to run them. Is there a `./mvnw` command I'm not seeing?

After the DM talk, this issue exists, but the reason is another thread could getu list still in the initialization stage, due to first element added. So we need a local variable to avoid this. Also, notice this happens only in concurrency class loader env.
Don't support this.
那这个升级就没法搞了, 这么多服务器不可能停机啊
@kezhenxu94 Hi, Zhenxu. please help me to review if you have time, thanks.
reas the file in the .github folder, there are a lot of yaml file controlling e2e. It is easy to follow. Those are GitHub action control files.
I also encountered this issue. Is there any time line to fix? @wu-sheng
No, it wouldn't. Once it is sampled, it will be traced in the distributed env.
This is not the design. If you want to know the result, read he source codes.
Simple answer, change the source codes.

english pls。

We are hosted in the Apache Software Foundation. We just ask for English on GitHub and Apache mail list, as the official channel, we need a global language. If you want to use Chinese, we support that in the QQ group.

> 我寻思这项目不是国人开发的吗？

I am a Chinese and Mandarin is my native language, this is for sure. But SkyWalking today is not only written by me, also is not written by Chinese people only. We have users/contributors/committers all over the world, English is not the native language for many of them too. But we need to communicate, that is why we choose English, that is the reason.

> 有个双语文档很难吗？

That is not about the hard and easy, that is workload. We have volunteers working on that, if you have simply searched the GitHub, you have already found that, rather than complaining here. https://github.com/SkyAPM/document-cn-translation-of-skywalking.
But we can't guarantee it is always updated, and it is always correct. as it is not official and out of date multiple times, it can't be listed in the Apache repo.
